summary: Romanian is the main language of Romania and Moldova, with around 25 million speakers. It's part of the Romance language family, which includes languages like French and Italian. Romanian comes from a dialect called Daco-Romanian and is closely related to other languages like Aromanian. In Moldova, it was once known as Moldovan, but in 2013, the Constitutional Court decided it's officially called Romanian. Recently, Moldova's Parliament and president agreed to use the name "Romanian" in all official documents.
title: Romanian language
